node.name: networks
node.description: Serves as a top-level container for a list of networks.None

node.name: network
node.description: Describes a network. A network typically contains an inventory of nodes, topological information (augmented through the network-topology data model), and layering information.None

node.name: network-types
node.description: Serves as an augmentation target. The network type is indicated through corresponding presence containers augmented into this container.None

node.name: l3t:l3-unicast-topology
node.description: The presence of the container node indicates L3 Unicast topologyNone

node.name: fabric:fabric-network
node.description: The presence of the container node indicates fabric topologyNone

node.name: supporting-network
node.description: An underlay network, used to represent layered network topologies.None

node.name: node
node.description: The inventory of nodes of this network.None

node.name: node-id
node.description: Uniquely identifies a node within the containing network.None

node.name: supporting-node
node.description: Represents another node that is in an underlay network and that supports this node. Used to represent layering structure.None

node.name: network-ref
node.description: References the underlay network of which the underlay node is a part.None

node.name: nt:termination-point
node.description: A termination point can terminate a link. Depending on the type of topology, a termination point could, for example, refer to a port or an interface.None

node.name: nt:supporting-termination-point
node.description: This list identifies any termination points on which a given termination point depends or onto which it maps. Those termination points will themselves be contained in a supporting node. This dependency information can be inferred from the dependencies between links. Therefore, this item is not separately configurable. Hence, no corresponding constraint needs to be articulated. The corresponding information is simply provided by the implementing system.None

node.name: nt:network-ref
node.description: This leaf identifies in which topology the supporting termination point is present.None

node.name: nt:node-ref
node.description: This leaf identifies in which node the supporting termination point is present.None

node.name: nt:tp-ref
node.description: Reference to the underlay node (the underlay node must be in a different topology).None

node.name: l3t:unnumbered-id
node.description: Unnumbered interface identifier. The identifier will correspond to the ifIndex value of the interface, i.e., the ifIndex value of the ifEntry that represents the interface in implementations where the Interfaces Group MIB (RFC 2863) is supported.None

node.name: l3t:interface-name
node.description:
Name of the interface. The name can (but does not have to) correspond to an interface reference of a containing node's interface, i.e., the path name of a corresponding interface data node on the containing node reminiscent of data type interface-ref defined in RFC 8343. It should be noted that data type interface-ref of RFC 8343 cannot be used directly,
as this data type is used to reference an interface in a datastore of a single node in the network, not to uniquely reference interfaces across a network.None

node.name: fabric:role
node.description: Role of the port in a fabric.None

node.name: fabric:device-port
node.description: The device port it mapped to.None

node.name: fabric:tunnel-option
node.description: Tunnel options to connect two fabrics. It could be L2 Tunnel or L3 Tunnel.None

node.name: l3t:prefix
node.description: A list of prefixes along with their attributesNone

node.name: fabric:fabric-id
node.description: An identifier for a fabric in a topology. This identifier can be generated when composing a fabric. The composition of a fabric can be achieved by defining an RPC, which is left for vendor-specific implementation and not provided in this model.None

node.name: fabric:type
node.description: The type of physical network that implements this fabric. Examples are VLAN and TRILL.None

node.name: fabric:vni-capacity
node.description: The range of the VXLAN Network Identifier (VNI) defined in RFC 7348 that the POD uses.None

node.name: fabric:capability-supported
node.description: It provides a list of supported services of the fabric. The service-capabilities is defined as identity-ref. Users can define more services by defining new identities.None

node.name: fabric:device-nodes
node.description: Device nodes that are included in a fabric.None

node.name: fabric:device-ref
node.description: The device that the fabric includes that refers to a node in another topology.None

node.name: fabric:role
node.description: It is a list of device roles to represent the roles that a device plays within a POD, such as SPINE, LEAF, Border, or Border-Leaf. The device role is defined as identity-ref. If more than 2 stages are used for a POD, users can define new identities for the device role.None

node.name: fabric:device-links
node.description: Links that are included within a fabric.None

node.name: fabric:link-ref
node.description: The link that the fabric includes that refers to a link in another topology.None

node.name: fabric:device-ports
node.description: Ports that are included in the fabric.None

node.name: fabric:port-ref
node.description: The port that the fabric includes that refers to a termination-point in another topology.None

node.name: fabric:port-type
node.description: Port type is defined as identity-ref. The current types include ethernet or serial. If more types are needed, developers can define new identities.None

node.name: fabric:bandwidth
node.description: Bandwidth of the port. It is defined as identity-ref. If more speeds are introduced, developers can define new identities for them. Current speeds include 1M, 10M, 100M, 1G, 10G, 25G, 40G, 100G, and 400G.None

node.name: cl-oam:test-point-ipv4-location-list
node.description: Serves as top-level container for test point location list.None

node.name: cl-oam:ni
node.description: The ni is used to describe the corresponding network instanceNone

node.name: cl-oam:technology-null
node.description: This is a placeholder when no technology is needed.None

node.name: cl-oam:tech-null
node.description: There is no technology to be defined.None

node.name: cl-oam:tp-tools
node.description: Container for test point OAM toolset.None

node.name: cl-oam:continuity-check
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the Continuity Check function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:path-discovery
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the path discovery function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:root
node.description: Root for models supported per test point.None

node.name: cl-oam:oam-neighboring-tps
node.description: List of neighboring test points in the same layer that are related to current test point. If the neighboring test point is placed after the current test point, the position is specified as +1. If the neighboring test point is placed before the current test point, the position is specified as -1; if no neighboring test points are placed before or after the current test point in the same layer, the position is specified as 0.None

node.name: cl-oam:index
node.description: Index of a list of neighboring test points in layers up and down the stack for the same interface that are related to the current test point.None

node.name: cl-oam:position
node.description: The position of the neighboring test point relative to the current test point. Level 0 indicates a test point corresponding to a specific index in the same layer as the current test point. -1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point down the stack, and +1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point up the stack.None

node.name: cl-oam:test-point-ipv6-location-list
node.description: Serves as top-level container for test point location list.None

node.name: cl-oam:ni
node.description: The ni is used to describe the corresponding network instance.None

node.name: cl-oam:technology-null
node.description: This is a placeholder when no technology is needed.None

node.name: cl-oam:tech-null
node.description: There is no technology to be defined.None

node.name: cl-oam:tp-tools
node.description: Container for test point OAM toolset.None

node.name: cl-oam:continuity-check
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the Continuity Check function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:path-discovery
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the path discovery function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:root
node.description: Root for models supported per test point.None

node.name: cl-oam:oam-neighboring-tps
node.description: List of neighboring test points in the same layer that are related to current test point. If the neighboring test point is placed after the current test point, the position is specified as +1. If the neighboring test point is placed before the current test point, the position is specified as -1; if no neighboring test points are placed before or after the current test point in the same layer, the position is specified as 0.None

node.name: cl-oam:index
node.description: Index of a list of neighboring test points in layers up and down the stack for the same interface that are related to the current test point.None

node.name: cl-oam:position
node.description: The position of the neighboring test point relative to the current test point. Level 0 indicates a test point corresponding to a specific index in the same layer as the current test point. -1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point down the stack, and +1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point up the stack.None

node.name: cl-oam:mac-location-type
node.description: Container for MAC address location types.None

node.name: cl-oam:test-point-mac-address-location-list
node.description: Serves as top-level container for test point location list.None

node.name: cl-oam:technology-null
node.description: This is a placeholder when no technology is needed.None

node.name: cl-oam:tech-null
node.description: There is no technology to be defined.None

node.name: cl-oam:tp-tools
node.description: Container for test point OAM toolset.None

node.name: cl-oam:continuity-check
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the Continuity Check function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:path-discovery
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the path discovery function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:root
node.description: Root for models supported per test point.None

node.description: List of neighboring test points in the same layer that are related to current test point. If the neighboring test point is placed after the current test point, the position is specified as +1. If the neighboring test point is placed before the current test point, the position is specified as -1; if no neighboring test points are placed before or after the current test point in the same layer, the position is specified as 0.None

node.name: cl-oam:index
node.description: Index of a list of neighboring test points in layers up and down the stack for the same interface that are related to the current test point.None

node.name: cl-oam:position
node.description: The position of the neighboring test point relative to the current test point. Level 0 indicates a test point corresponding to a specific index in the same layer as the current test point. -1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point down the stack, and +1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point up the stack.None

node.name: cl-oam:group-as-number-location-type
node.description: Container for AS number location types.None

node.name: cl-oam:test-point-as-number-location-list
node.description: Serves as top-level container for test point location list.None

node.name: cl-oam:ni
node.description: The ni is used to describe the corresponding network instance.None

node.name: cl-oam:technology-null
node.description: This is a placeholder when no technology is needed.None

node.name: cl-oam:tech-null
node.description: There is no technology to be defined.None

node.name: cl-oam:tp-tools
node.description: Container for test point OAM toolset.None

node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the Continuity Check function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:path-discovery
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the path discovery function is supported.None

node.description: Root for models supported per test point.None

Level 0 indicates a test point corresponding to a specific index in the same layer as the current test point. -1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point down the stack, and +1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point up the stack.None

node.name: cl-oam:group-router-id-location-type
node.description: Container for system ID location types.None

node.name: cl-oam:test-point-system-info-location-list
node.description: Serves as top-level container for test point location list.None

node.name: cl-oam:ni
node.description: The ni is used to describe the corresponding network instance.None

node.name: cl-oam:technology-null
node.description: This is a placeholder when no technology is needed.None

node.name: cl-oam:tech-null
node.description: There is no technology to be defined.None

node.name: cl-oam:tp-tools
node.description: Container for test point OAM toolset.None

node.name: cl-oam:continuity-check
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the Continuity Check function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:path-discovery
node.description: A flag indicating whether or not the path discovery function is supported.None

node.name: cl-oam:root
node.description: Root for models supported per test point.None

node.name: cl-oam:oam-neighboring-tps
node.description: List of neighboring test points in the same layer that are related to current test point. If the neighboring test point is placed after the current test point, the position is specified as +1. Level 0 indicates a test point corresponding to a specific index in the same layer as the current test point. -1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point down the stack, and +1 means there is a test point corresponding to a specific index in the test point up the stack.None

node.name: nt:link
node.description: A network link connects a local (source) node and a remote (destination) node via a set of the respective node's termination points. It is possible to have several links between the same source and destination nodes. Likewise, a link could potentially be re-homed between termination points. Therefore, in order to ensure that we would always know to distinguish between links, every link is identified by a dedicated link identifier. Note that a link models a point-to-point link, not a multipoint link.None

node.name: nt:link-id
node.description: The identifier of a link in the topology. A link is specific to a topology to which it belongs.None

node.name: nt:source
node.description: This container holds the logical source of a particular link.None

node.name: nt:source-node
node.description: Source node identifier. Must be in the same topology.None

node.name: nt:source-tp
node.description: This termination point is located within the source node and terminates the link.None

node.name: nt:destination
node.description: This container holds the logical destination of a particular link.None

node.name: nt:dest-node
node.description: Destination node identifier. Must be in the same network.None

node.name: nt:dest-tp
node.description: This termination point is located within the destination node and terminates the link.None

node.name: nt:supporting-link
node.description: Identifies the link or links on which this link depends.None

node.name: nt:network-ref
node.description: This leaf identifies in which underlay topology the supporting link is present.None

node.name: nt:link-ref
node.description: This leaf identifies a link that is a part of this link's underlay. Reference loops in which a link identifies itself as its underlay, either directly or transitively, are not allowed.None
